reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My daughter and son-in-law chose the Ballachulish Hotel as the venue for their wedding on the 14 April 2012. This was a fantastic choice! The hotel is in a the most beautiful setting, the views from the front of the hotel are breathtaking.
reviews.title: Great venue for a wedding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As most of the guests were travelling quite a distance they all stayed for the weekend. The hotel provided us with an excellent reduced tarriff for the accommodation. The ceremony was held in the large lounge at the front of the hotel - a lovely room with lots of character, and the reception in the dining room, and there is a dance area where we had a ceilidh.
reviews.title: Excellent stay, Thank you.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Frank the manager could not have been more helpful and we would like to thank him and his staff for making this such a special day for Amy and Jon.
reviews.title: We will be back!

reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights which were given to us as a gift and we had a wonderful stay. Our room was in the west wing and although we have stayed in plusher rooms than this, it was functional and with a huge bed and a fantastic view, stunning! when your somewhere like here you dont want to spend too much time in your room anyway. We also ate in the hotel and both really liked our evening meal top marks - on the second night went to the 'Holly Tree' down the road and we were disappointed, it was ok but made me wish i'd stayed for dinner at the hotel. Breakfast had plenty of choice however we're not keen on the help yourself to the hot breakfast, i dont think it would be much to make the cooked breakfast to order - we have had this at other hotels (smaller family run-which means that its not the chef making the breakfast) anyway it was ok and thats probably just personal choice. The Hotel had great character and staff were fantastic, very helpful. Thank you for having us as your guests and giving us a great break.
reviews.title: A comfortable short break

reviews.text: We stayed here on a DB&B deal which included bottle of wine on each evening plus a free round of golf each day. The golf course is remarkably well kept for a pay and play course and the surrounding scenery made it a very pleasant round of golf for my husband and a lovely walk for myself.
reviews.title: Overrated and disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a mini-break here for some peace and quiet in gorgeous surroundings.
reviews.title: Cosy hotel full of old fashioned charm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a really nice room on the top floor overlooking the water. The only real complaint was that the hotel was too warm - which is far preferable to being cold. The staff were equally warm and friendly.
reviews.title: loved this trip
bookings
reviews.text: We had dinner here on our first night as part of our deal, which included dinner and a bottle of wine. The dinner was good, the wine was not - bottle left in room. However, I have to be fair and say this was a deal we took advantage of so it was fairly good value for money.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The surrounding area is beautiful with nice walks and good roads to visit Fort William or Oban.
reviews.title: Kev & Sue from Mansfield

reviews.text: Would I return to this particular hotel - probably not, but only because are so many beautiful other parts of Scotland I would like to sample.
reviews.title: ballachulish hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked because the hotel said it was pet-friendly. It isn't. Given a room directly above the kitchens so it was very noisy and unbearably hot. Also as it was on the first floor it was hardly good for the dog anyway. We ordered breakfast in the room which turned up without tea spoons, or milk for cereal. Also as my partner is pregnant we asked for 1 decaf and 1 normal coffee; two pots turned up but with no identification as to which was which so we had to guess. Although we did stay here I would not come again and to coin a phrase - I wouldn't even board my dog here. The only positive is the location, but in the Highlands of Scotland there are loads of hotels which have equally stunning views that you would be better off staying in.
reviews.title: Poor. Not recommended

reviews.text: Perfect setting for my marriage proposal on 30th Mar. Beautiful sunshine up at Inchree waterfalls where I popped the question. Hotel made up my room with my pre-ordered flowers chocolates. Thank you for a great day, evening, meal and stay
reviews.title: Perfect in every way location, weather, service, views. Just pure magic!!!!
Glencoe Anxiety
reviews.text: Charming building on a most beautiful location. Unfortunately our experience was not so good. Locked out of our room with all our luggage inside for 6.5 hors. After not being able to contact maint person and after furtive & futile attempts of young staff member to Jimmie the lock the cook was summoned, and with brute scottish strength he had the door kicked in with three mighty blows. We were left wondering when Jihn Cleese was going to arrive as Polly, Cybil & Manuel were all there. They had the extravagant nerve to only offer us a 10 pound discount after we pressed them hard on checking out. The poor service et down the location & potential.
I stayed at this hotel recently and it is in the perfect postion for exploring Oban and the isles!
reviews.title: Fantastic location and a perfect base.

reviews.text: I was luck enough to get a great deal on my room at just £35 b&b per night and was very happy with my room (206 fantastic Loch view) and the perfect breakfast to set you up for the day!
reviews.title: £200 a night your having a laugh

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: despite being questioned about validity of voucher which to expire at end of april - receptionist was amadant end of march - my wife had to convince its validity! anyway good stay with evening meals being nice and the breakfast was JUST above average. dining room viewing over the loch - cannae ask for a better scenic view!!
reviews.title: good overnight break with good dry sunny cold weather

reviews.text: My brother and his wife got married in the Ballachulish hotel on 14 April. The atmosphere was lovely, it was more like being in someone's home rather than a standard wedding venue.
reviews.title: Great venue for weddings, relexation and star gazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Frank and his team were fantastic. Nothing is too much trouble for them and they make people feel welcome. This is a small hotel that does not specialise in fine dining however the presentation and quality of the meals served exceeded my expectations.
reviews.title: Relax the scenery is beautiful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself is charming. The views across the Loch are beautiful and the area is peaceful and relaxing. There is some wear and tear in parts of the hotel however nothing that detracts from the charm of the venue. The rooms are large, quiet and bathrooms are well appointed and clean.
reviews.title: Ballachulish hotel - worth a stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At night time it's is worth crossing the road over the to Loch side to do some star gazing.
reviews.title: very nice
